thread.title: Eden Hazard gives Chelsea a massive boost as he returns to training ahead of Crystal Palace clash
thread.title_full: Eden Hazard gives Chelsea a massive boost as he returns to training ahead of Crystal Palace clash

author: Jim Daly
title: Eden Hazard gives Chelsea a massive boost as he returns to training ahead of Crystal Palace clash
text:
Eden Hazard gives Chelsea a massive boost as he returns to training ahead of Crystal Palace clash There had been question marks over whether he would play due to injury Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Eden Hazard returned to Chelsea training amid reports he would miss Saturday's clash with Palace through injury. 
The Blues star pulled out of international duty, having missed Chelsea's win at Stoke with a calf injury, and it looked like he might be unavailable for Antonio Conte too. 
But he looked in good spirits during Thursday's training session where team-mate Thibaut Courtois also returned from injury. 
Courtois played in Belgium's World Cup qualifying draw with Greece but missed the friendly draw with Russia on Tuesday night and has required treatment for a hip injury. (Photo: Chelsea FC/Getty Images) Pedro (Photo: Chelsea FC/Getty Images) David Luiz and Diego Costa (Photo: Chelsea FC/Getty Images) Antonio Conte (Photo: Chelsea FC/Getty Images) 
Premier League leaders Chelsea enter this weekend's fixtures with a 10-point lead at the top of the table. 
Palace's Christioan Benteke, who scored twice in the 3-3 draw with Russia that Hazard missed had already claimed he thought the Chelsea man would play this weekend. 
He said: “Yes I think he will play. He came into the dressing room after the match against Greece. 
"He told me he could have played but it would have been a big risk to aggravate his injury With a few days rest, he should be ready.” poll loading Will Chelsea win the double in Antonio Conte's first season at Stamford Bridge? 0+ VOTES SO FAR Yes No 
Chelsea's Premier League clash with Middlesbrough has been switched to Monday, May 8 at Stamford Bridge. 
That could potentially see Chelsea celebrate winning the title, although their home fixture with Watford is still to be arranged. 
Hazard was this week linked with a £100million move to Real Madrid, a topic which is sure to arise in head coach Antonio Conte's pre-match media conference on Friday. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
